DataElement.preferredName: Prostate Specific Antigen Pathology and/or Imaging Report Concordance Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether or not the Prostate Specific Antigen (PSA) was concordant with the pathology and/or imaging report.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prostate Specific Antigen Measurement Pathology And/Or Medical Imaging Report Concordance
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The determination of the prostate specific antigen present in a sample._The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Informally used to mean the result of such an examination._Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid._Any technology which helps in visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for the screening, diagnosis, surgical procedure or therapy._A short textual account; having provided a short account._An agreement of findings.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The determination of the prostate specific antigen present in a sample

Concepts.definition: The determination of the prostate specific antigen present in a sample.

Property.preferredName: Pathology And/Or Medical Imaging Report Concordance
Property.preferredDefinition: The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Informally used to mean the result of such an examination.:Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.:In medicine, any technology which helps in visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for the screening, diagnosis, surgical procedure or therapy.:A short textual account; having provided a short account.:An agreement of findings.

Concepts.definition: The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Informally used to mean the result of such an examination.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
In medicine, any technology which helps in visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for the screening, diagnosis, surgical procedure or therapy.
A short textual account; having provided a short account.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for Dr. Turkbey P173316 request 11.21.17 mc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/not applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.
